intro: Schultesianthus uniflorus, commonly known as the single-flower schultesianthus, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and a single, showy flower that typically blooms in the summer. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals and a central stamen. Schultesianthus uniflorus is often found in dry, open habitats such as savannas and rocky areas.
